andygrove commented on pull request #4020: ARROW-4596: [Rust][DataFusion] COUNT aggregation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4020#discussion_r268404096
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/compute/array_ops.rs
 ##########
 @@ -103,6 +103,21 @@ where
     }
 }
 
+/// Returns the number of not-null values in the array.
+///
+/// Returns `None` if the array is empty.
+pub fn count(array: &Array) -> Option<usize>
+where
+{
+    let null_count = array.null_count();
+    let n = array.len();
+    if n == 0 {
+        None
+    } else {
+        Some(n - null_count)
+    }
+}
+
 
 Review comment:
   looks good

andygrove commented on issue #4020: ARROW-4596: [Rust][DataFusion] COUNT aggregation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4020#issuecomment-475893426
 
 
   Regarding the question about accumulating the values ... you need to calculate the count for each batch and then add those together at the end (not count them). I'm guessing you are getting 2 because you are counting the number of batches.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4020#issuecomment-475893518
 
 
   I don't think the trait needs to change. `COUNT(expr)` is the same as `SUM(1) WHERE expr NOT NULL` so the logic working for SUM should work for COUNT.

     }
 }

+#[derive(Debug)]
+struct CountFunction {
+    data_type: DataType,
 
 Review comment:
   We do need a `DataType` though if the `AggregateFunction` trait has to be implement for `CountFunction`, don't we?
   I could avoid implementing the `AggregateFunction` trait for `CountFunction`, but then I don't see how we could use `CountFunction` in the context of `AccumulatorSet`.

     }
 }
 
+/// Implemntation of COUNT aggregate function
+#[derive(Debug)]
+struct CountFunction {
+    data_type: DataType,
 
 Review comment:
   The data type of count should always be `usize`. Yes, we still need to implement the `AggregateFunction` trait, but the return_type method can be hard-coded as returning `DataType::UInt32`. The data type of count is not related to the data type of the things being counted.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Add support for COUNT aggregate function. See SUM function in aggregates.rs for inspiration.

SQL parser should support COUNT(1) and COUNT ( * ) syntax for counting rows as well as COUNT(column_name) for counting non-null values for a column.

COUNT(DISTINCT expr) should be handled in a separate issue since it is more complex.

comments.body: I'd be happy to work on this! Should I ask you to mark it as in progress [~andygrove]?
[~LukeMathWalker] I just added you to the Contributor role so you should be able to click "start progress" now which will also assign the issue to you
Hi [~LukeMathWalker], Arrow developers will be releasing an 0.13 RC probably in the next few days. Are you still comfortable with getting this ready by then, or should we move it to the 0.14 release?
Hi [~nevi_me], I have started working on this but I don't think I will be able to wrap it up before 0.13 is released!
